directions: Place cornbread mix in a gallon-size resealable bag; season with salt and black pepper. Add squash, seal bag, and shake to coat evenly. Remove squash from bag and shake off any excess cornmeal.

Heat about 1/4 inch of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry squash in the hot oil, working in batches, until center is cooked and edges are crisp, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
ingredients: 3/4 cup self-rising cornbread mix (such as Martha White®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1/4 cup olive oil, or more as needed
title: Fried Yellow Squash
